channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: A result that puts Leeds safe, Forest in trouble - and Dyche in doubt?
item.description: After Leeds' win over Nottingham Forest on Friday, BBC Sport looks at what it all means for the Premier League relegation battle.

item.title: Some 'dark days and nights' at Arsenal, happiness at Sunderland
item.description: Granit Xhaka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his motivation for joining Sunderland, and falling out with the Arsenal fans.

item.title: Barcelona withdraw from European Super League project
item.description: Barcelona withdraw from the European Super League project, leaving rivals Real Madrid as the only one of the original 12 clubs still signed up to the plans.

item.title: 'I feel at home here' - Carrick hints he wants Man Utd stay
item.description: Michael Carrick drops the first hint he wants to remain as Manchester United head coach beyond the end of this season

item.title: From £70 a week to brink of Premier League record 24 years later
item.description: James Milner will equal the Premier League appearance record if he features for Brighton on Sunday, 24 years after making his debut as a 16-year-old.

item.title: Leeds beat Forest to move clear of relegation zone
item.description: Leeds United move nine points clear of the Premier League's relegation zone, with a dominant 3-1 win over fellow strugglers Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Saudi club to offload Ronaldo for £43m - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Saudi Pro League is ready to offload Cristiano Ronaldo for £43m, Chelsea set to rival Tottenham for Dusan Vlahovic, while Sergio Ramos offers his services to Marseille, plus more.

item.title: 'Football aspect of Liverpool season not so important after Jota'
item.description: Former Liverpool goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher says performances and results at his old club are not quite as important this season following the death of Diogo Jota.

item.title: Why should I not express how I feel? - Guardiola
item.description: Pep Guardiola defended his stance of speaking up about global conflicts by asking, "why should I not express what I feel, just because I am a manager?"

item.title: Dundee Utd v Spartans & Aberdeen v Motherwell off after heavy rain
item.description: Dundee United v Spartans is the latest Scottish Cup game to be called off.

item.title: 'Why young British managers need lower-league experience'
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why he thinks there is a negative reaction to British managers when they get jobs in the Premier League - and the path young coaches should take.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Gladiators star Apollo
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Gladiators star Apollo and AI with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Bompastor extends Chelsea contract until 2030
item.description: Chelsea head coach Sonia Bompastor signs a contract extension with the Women's Super League club until 2030.

item.title: Fiery scenes in stands halt Bundesliga match
item.description: Watch the moment a referee is forced to stop play in the match between Union Berlin and Eintracht Frankfurt in the Bundesliga, after the home fans set off flares in the stands in celebration of their 60th birthday.

item.title: I will never forget what he did for me - Xhaka on Arteta
item.description: Granit Xhaka speaks to Kelly Somers to discuss why he chose to play for Sunderland and his relationship with his former Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta.

item.title: 'Nowhere near acceptable' - Dyche bemoans 'awful' goals
item.description: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche is critical of defensive mistakes as they lose 3-1 at Leeds United in the Premier League.

item.title: Calvert-Lewin the 'perfect goalscorer' - Farke
item.description: Manager Daniel Farke is full of praise for striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, who scored as Leeds United beat Nottingham Forest 3-1 in the Premier League.

item.title: Why time is running out for Milan's iconic San Siro
item.description: BBC Sport visits the San Siro in Milan, the venue for the Winter Olympics opening ceremony, to find out why this could be the last global event held at the iconic stadium, and what comes next.

item.title: How Casemiro revived his Man Utd career
item.description: Casemiro's Manchester United career looked to be petering out, but the veteran midfielder has found a return to form this season.

item.title: 'Leicester dream torn apart by unprecedented spending'
item.description: Leicester, Premier League champions a decade ago, face a relegation fight after being docked 10 points for financial rule breaches.

item.title: Ex-players have 'duty of responsibility' as pundits - Van Dijk
item.description: Former players turned pundits have a "duty of responsibility" to the new generation of footballers when commenting on their performances, Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk says.

item.title: Oxlade-Chamberlain ready for short-term Celtic move, says O'Neill
item.description: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain will have a medical on Saturday before signing with Celtic for the remainder of the season, says manager Martin O'Neill.

item.title: Putellas' future? Chelsea's quiet window? Emma Sanders Q&A
item.description: BBC Sport reporter Emma Sanders takes fans' questions on the Women's Super League, the transfer window and the future of Alexia Putellas.

item.title: Talbi rocket seals decisive Sunderland win over Burnley
item.description: Watch highlights as Sunderland earn a decisive victory over struggling Burnley, capped by an incredible long-range goal from Chemsdine Talbi.

item.title: Solanke scorpion kick helps Spurs fight back against Man City
item.description: Dominic Solanke scores twice, including a spectacular scorpion kick, as Tottenham come from behind to draw against Manchester City with a rousing second-half performance.

item.title: Sesko scores dramatic late winner as Man Utd beat Fulham
item.description: Manchester United avoided Fulham's late comeback due to a Benjamin Sesko goal in stoppage time to give United three points and continue head coach Michael Carrick's perfect start.

item.title: 10-man Brentford hold on for hard-fought win at Villa
item.description: Brentford hold on to an important win against Aston Villa, despite Kevin Schade's sending off during the first half.

item.title: Sarr earns Palace draw at Forest as Williams sees red for handball
item.description: Neco Williams is sent off for deliberate handball in Nottingham Forest's draw with Crystal Palace, as he punched Jefferson Lerma's goalbound header off the line.

item.title: Ekitike double helps Liverpool cruise past Newcastle
item.description: Summer signing Hugo Ekitike scores twice as Liverpool record their first league win of 2026, putting four goals past Newcastle United.

item.title: Ronaldo misses second game in a row for Al-Nassr
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo is left out of the Al-Nassr squad for a second game in a row amid doubts over his future at the Saudi Arabian club.

item.title: Ex-Villa striker Duran set for sixth club aged 22
item.description: Former Aston Villa striker Jhon Duran is set to join the sixth club of his career at the age of just 22.

item.title: Knee injury could scupper Mateta's World Cup 'dream'
item.description: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner indicates the injury that scuppered Jean-Philippe Mateta's move to AC Milan could also thwart the striker's "dream" of playing for France at the World Cup, if surgery is needed.

item.title: Five things in the EFL: Unlikely six-pointers and falls from grace
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look at the intriguing stories continuing to unfold across the EFL this weekend.

item.title: Why is every EFL game kicking off one minute later this weekend?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why matches in all three English Football League divisions are kicking off one minute later than usual this weekend.

item.title: Leicester urged to 'take medicine and move on' after six-point penalty
item.description: Leicester City "should take their medicine" and accept their points penalty for breaking spending rules, says former Foxes striker Matty Fryatt.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: O'Neill calls for 'middle ground' amid Celtic boycott plans
item.description: Manager Martin O'Neill describes the prospect of meetings between the Celtic board and supporters' groups as "a big step forward" and hopes a "middle ground" can be found to end the acrimony around the club.

item.title: Man Utd prepare to honour Munich disaster victims
item.description: It is impossible to fully understand the magnitude of the crash that killed 23 people, eight of them Manchester United players, until you work for the club, says women's coach Marc Skinner.

item.title: Why are Real Madrid players training in masks?
item.description: Real Madrid players have been pictured taking part in high-intensity drills while wearing unusual blue masks - so what's the reason for them?

item.title: Arsenal lack of respect behind outburst - Rosenior
item.description: Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior says Arsenal were affecting his side's warm-up prior to the second leg of their Carabao Cup semi-final at Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Are Chelsea-Strasbourg transfer deals bad for football?
item.description: Chelsea and Strasbourg have completed 12 transfer deals this summer. Is it out of the ordinary, and might Fifa get involved?

item.title: Penalty rescues point for Union Berlin against 10-man Frankfurt
item.description: Centre-back Leopold Querfeld's penalty in the 87th minute helps Union Berlin earn a 1-1 draw against 10-man Eintracht Frankfurt in the Bundesliga.

item.title: King and Walcott on pressure of breaking into first-team football
item.description: Fulham's Josh King and former England and Arsenal winger Theo Walcott open up on the challenges of breaking into first-team football.

item.title: How can Man City get Haaland firing again?
item.description: BBC Sport's football tactics correspondent Umir Irfan analyses why Manchester City striker Erling Haaland has stopped scoring in the Premier League and looks at ways Pep Guardiola can get the centre-forward scoring regularly again.

item.title: 206 goals for Newcastle - but which were Shearer's best?
item.description:
It's 20 years to the day since Alan Shearer became Newcastle United's all-time leading goalscorer, with his 201st strike in black and white.
But which of his 206 Toon goals stand out? Alan picked his favourites earlier this season on Football Focus, live from St James' Park.

item.title: Inside Man City's rebuild and plan for life without Guardiola
item.description: BBC Sport looks at Manchester City's evolution and why the January window has offered renewed belief.

item.title: The talented playmaker no-one seems to want
item.description: Harvey Elliott is one of England's most gifted young players - but neither Aston Villa or Liverpool appear to rate the midfielder.

item.title: 'Strong and smart' - Liverpool's £60m man, who can 'become like Van Dijk'
item.description: Jeremy Jacquet will join Liverpool for £60m from Rennes in the summer - but why are the Reds signing him?

item.title: The most powerful woman in football - meet game's first female super agent
item.description: Super agent Rafaela Pimenta looks after some of the biggest names in the game - and has spoken exclusively to the BBC.

item.title: Nine siblings and a dog called Zoomer - Wirtz in his own words
item.description: Florian Wirtz sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his slow start at Anfield, playing padel and making Bundesliga history.

item.title: All the done deals on deadline day in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What do you get for winning EFL Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the winner of the Carabao Cup gets.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Horneland a leading candidate for Aberdeen job
item.description: Eirik Horneland has emerged as a leading candidate for the manager's job at Aberdeen.

item.title: Years after coming out as Scotland's only gay footballer, I'm so much happier
item.description: The former striker now devotes his time to championing others as a public speaker and activist.

item.title: Real and England wait on Bellingham injury
item.description: Real Madrid are waiting to discover if midfielder Jude Bellingham faces a spell out after he suffers a muscle injury during the win against Rayo Vallecano.

item.title: Barca president unhappy at teen's 'unpleasant' PSG move
item.description: PSG sign 18-year-old Barcelona midfielder Dro Fernandez, with the Spanish side's president calling the situation around the transfer "unpleasant".

item.title: The Basque derby - the friendliest rivalry in world football?
item.description: With a sense of shared identity and fans mixing in the stands, is the Basque derby between Athletic Club and Real Sociedad the friendliest in the world?

item.title: Why are Paris St-Germain struggling to hit top form?
item.description: European champions PSG face Newcastle in the Champions League on Wednesday - but why have Luis Enrique's side not been at their best so far this term?

item.title: Bayern legend? How Kane is viewed in Germany as contract talks begin
item.description: Harry Kane is entering the final 18 months of his Bayern Munich contract, and the German champions are eager to keep the prolific striker, as German football writer Constantin Eckner explains.

item.title: Ex-England netball boss Neville takes Stockport role
item.description: Former England netball player and head coach Tracey Neville is appointed managing director of the Stockport County Women football team.

item.title: Fishlock has 'had conversations' over Wales role
item.description: Jess Fishlock says she is "fleshing out the details" over a potential role with Wales following her retirement from international football.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
